alert.note: Alert for Northern Lake County; Orange; Osceola; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 5:42PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Lake, western Orange and northwestern Osceola Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 542 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Howey-In-the-hills to near Oakland to near Haines City. Movement was northeast at 10 to 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Kissimmee, Apopka, Ocoee and Winter Garden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!

area.areaDesc: Northern Lake County; Orange; Osceola; Southern Lake County
